image.altText: A woman stares down the barrel of a camera.

props.synopsis: Kmart is facing court action alleging some of its products may have been sourced from factories in China linked to forced labour.

title.children: Kmart facing legal action over belief it's sourcing products linked to forced labour

image.altText: A composite photo of a person holding a bag plus CCTV images.

props.synopsis: From China in the 1980s to Australia now, this scam has fleeced vulnerable people of millions and because of FIFO criminals and underground cash laundering police are finding it hard to apprehend suspects.

title.children: Over 40 years this scam has raked in millions. It's incredibly hard to stop

image.altText: A bird's eye view of dozens of homes in a suburb, with a frame of one house being constructed.

props.synopsis: Australian property prices have faced three major speed bumps over the past four decades.

title.children: The one thing that could make housing affordable again

image.altText: The infamous bank building in the township of Snowtown.

props.synopsis: Convicted Snowtown murderer James Vlassakis has been granted parole after serving 26 years in jail.

title.children: Breaking: Snowtown murderer James Vlassakis granted parole after 26 years in jail

image.altText: Tourists pose in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: The US state department has prepared plans to impose bonds of up to $23,000 for some tourist and business visas under a pilot program launching in two weeks.

title.children: US to require up to $23,000 bonds for some tourists

image.altText: A photo of US president Donald Trump and Russian president Vladimir Putin with telephones.

props.synopsis: About six months into US President Donald Trump's second term, the Russia-Ukraine war continues to rage. Here's how the Trump-Putin relationship has waxed and waned since the beginning of the year.

title.children: Trump's shifting comments reveal how relations with Putin spiralled

image.altText: An elderly couple with their arms around each other

props.synopsis: The couple missing since Saturday on a flight from Tasmania to New South Wales with their dog have been named by Tasmania Police.

title.children: Couple aboard missing flight from Tasmania identified

image.altText: Pro-Palestinian protesters cross Sydney Harbour Bridge with flags, signs and umbrellas

props.synopsis: A renewed push to limit activists to staging three protests a year with taxpayer-funded crowd control has been shut down by the NSW government.

title.children: Push for protesters to pay for police after three events in NSW quashed

image.altText: A woman with long grey hair wearing a denim jacket looks at paperwork in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: Melanie and David Moor spent their life savings building a home on a newly subdivided block in Victoria. But they could lose it all after accidentally building on the wrong block.

title.children: Couple risk losing home after accidentally building on wrong block

image.altText: Police tape with police vehicles in the background of a suburban area.

props.synopsis: Police say two teenage girls were on exchange from China when one allegedly fatally stabbed the other near Newcastle.

title.children: Chinese exchange student arrested over fatal stabbing of 14yo compatriot

image.altText: A close up picture of a blonde woman smiling

props.synopsis: Police failed to act quickly enough on the escalating risk posed by an estranged husband to his wife, who he brutally stabbed to death after she went to his Perth home to sign some papers, a coronial inquest finds.

title.children: Breaking: Police failed to recognise escalating risk before Lynn Cannon murder, coroner finds

image.altText: Sam is wearing a black polo. she is sitting on a seat and there are two toddlers in the background

props.synopsis: Finding the right childcare centre can be a stressful experience. But for families in this coastal town, one provider is changing the lives of many.

title.children: Meet the preschool working to reach the 'gold standard' in education

image.altText: A Japanese frigate docked

props.synopsis: Japanese shipbuilder Mitsubishi Heavy Industries wins a fierce contest to build the Australian navy's new fleet of warships, beating a bid from German rival Thyssen­Krupp Marine Systems.

title.children: Australia picks Japan to build $10b frigates after fierce contest

image.altText: Tasmanian Labor leader Dean Winter

props.synopsis: With 10 seats, Labor's Dean Winter is still vying for power, but continues refusing discussions with the Greens. Meanwhile, Liberal Leader Jeremy Rockliff says he's about to formally ask the governor to again commission a minority Tasmanian government.

title.children: 'Basic maths': Greens say Winter has to negotiate if he wants to be premier

image.altText: A sign with the ad campaign tagline and a picture of sydney sweeney

props.synopsis: The US president throws his support behind the ad campaign, which faces mixed reviews online and is accused of alluding to theories of racial superiority.

title.children: Trump says 'Go get 'em' to Sydney Sweeney and 'fantastic' ad campaign

image.altText: Lloyd Perrett of the Sea Eagles is tackled by the Sharks defence

props.synopsis: Former Manly prop Lloyd Perrett has launched legal proceedings against the club for an alleged "outlandish training regime" that ended his promising NRL career.

title.children: Former Manly Sea Eagles prop launches legal claim against NRL club

image.altText: Simon Goodwin and Paul Roos with their arms crossed

props.synopsis: Paul Roos says Melbourne's stars have plenty to play for in the final three games of the season, adding that Simon Goodwin can't have been blindsided by the club's decision to sack him.

title.children: 'Do that at your own peril': Roos warns Demons after coach's sacking

image.altText: old and young hand together close up

props.synopsis: Feelings of guilt are common among carers who wish they could do more for their aging parents, says Carer's Australia CEO Annabel Reid.

title.children: The 'overwhelming guilt' Jennifer feels for placing her mum in aged care

image.altText: Tasmanian Labor leader Dean Winter

props.synopsis: With 10 seats, Labor's Dean Winter is still vying for power, but continues refusing discussions with the Greens. Meanwhile, Liberal Leader Jeremy Rockliff says he's about to formally ask the governor to again commission a minority Tasmanian government.

title.children: 'Basic maths': Greens say Winter has to negotiate if he wants to be premier

image.altText: abbott

props.synopsis: Republican Governor Greg Abbott has ordered authorities to arrest the dozens of Texas Democrats who fled the state to successfully block a vote on a Republican plan to redraw the state's congressional districts.

title.children: Texas governor orders arrest of Democrats who fled Texas

image.altText: Exterior of the entrance of the Melbourne Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: A man who bombarded politicians with "extraordinary" threats and antisemitic messages was desperate for help and support for autism, his lawyers say.

title.children: Autistic man sent politicians antisemitic messages, court hears

image.altText: A blue sign that says Malmsbury Youth Justice Precinct

props.synopsis: Worksafe charges the Victorian Department of Justice over a riot at the troubled Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre, in which a worker and several young people were assaulted.

title.children: Victorian government department faces charges over youth centre riot

image.altText: An old man with a mask and scarf, two young women and another gentlemen with a face covering walk into a court building.

props.synopsis: A former teacher on trial for allegedly abusing students tells a court he did have a sexual relationship with one of his former students, but only after he had graduated.

title.children: Ex-teacher tells court of 'occasional' sexual relationship with former student

image.altText: A police officer with arms out in front and a person in black jumper falling.

props.synopsis: New South Wales Police says it's reviewing a video circulating on social media which allegedly shows a police officer pushing a woman who then hits her head as she falls to the ground.

title.children: Video allegedly shows police officer pushing woman who hits head on post

image.altText: Picture of stock market board with ASX sign at the top left corner.

props.synopsis: Stock markets are overcooked and operating dangerously close to the Sun, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: Awash with cash, the investment world is feeding upon itself

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese, looking slightly stern as he talks.

props.synopsis: Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas tells Prime Minister Anthony Albanese that Australia could play an "important role" in achieving peace by joining others to recognise the state of Palestine.

title.children: PM speaks with Palestinian Authority in rare phone call

image.altText: A woman with short, brown hair wears a grey blazer and carries a manilla folder full of papers

props.synopsis: Dame Stella Rimington, the first woman to lead the UK's domestic secret service and the person believed to have inspired Judy Dench's characterisation of fictional spymaster M in the James Bond movies, has died.

title.children: Britain's first female spy boss dies aged 90

image.altText: black & white photo of Justin Bieber sitting on a floral couch holding a baby's legs above his head and behind his back

props.synopsis: A sonic departure from a pop powerhouse, lush Australian folk, dad rock, and so much more.

title.children: 10 albums we couldn't stop listening to in July

image.altText: Two lead smelters side by side in a composite image

props.synopsis: The owner of the Port Pirie and Hobart smelters says it has reached an agreement with the federal and state governments for $135 million in "transitionary support" for its metals manufacturing business.

title.children: Nyrstar to get $135 million bailout for struggling smelters

image.altText: A number of cans of energy drinks.

props.synopsis: As cases of blood toxicity from vitamin B6 continue to rise doctors raise concerns about the level of the product in food and especially energy drinks.

title.children: 'It's vitamin B6': Damage being caused by toxicity spreads to more products

image.altText: Tesla Powerwalls installed at a home.

props.synopsis: After surrendering its dominance of Australian electric vehicle sales, Tesla is also now also rapidly losing ground in the home battery market.

title.children: Tesla 'brand destruction' could cost it millions as battery sales boom

image.altText: Two selfies of an older man with white hair, stubble and bulging fake eye.

props.synopsis: The work of artificial eye maker Jack McDonald is again in question after more people come forward complaining about the eyes he has made for them.

title.children: 'My wife was crying': More complaints against prosthetic eye maker

image.altText: People are seen swimming in North Sydney Olympic Pool in Sydney

props.synopsis: The renovation of North Sydney Olympic Pool, located on the shores of Sydney Harbour, has taken three years longer than expected and is more than $60 million over budget.

title.children: The iconic Sydney pool and its jaw-dropping $122 million price tag

image.altText: Alex Zverev waves at the crowd after winning a match at the Canadian Open.

props.synopsis: After beating Australian defending champion Alexei Popyrin in the Canadian Open quarterfinals, top seed Alexander Zverev waves goodbye to a heckling fan in the stands.

title.children: Zverev returns serve at heckler after beating Aussie Popyrin in Toronto

image.altText: Jessica Seaborn, a young woman smiling, long brown hair, green top, leaning on desk

props.synopsis: Author Jessica Seaborn was inspired to write about friendships after mulling over how difficult it is to make friends in adulthood. Her new novel Isn't It Nice We Both Hate the Same Things is a story about best friends, losing friends and making new friends — if only it was so easy to find them.

title.children: Author inspired to write about adult friendships and how difficult it is to make new ones
